message:
Er... Leslie i don't think you're right. Before you keel over with anger. 1. If a man wore that his balls would hang out - that was where I was going. Just because her vagina doesn't fall out, I still find it indecent. It's an inappropriate garment full stop. It's
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
common decency. 3. Mulan, Disney film for kids. She is referred to as a 'cross dresser'. So no, it's not only applied to men. So I think your anger is a bit misplaced and you've turned a gender less comment on appropriateness of attire into a wider debate on gender....

message:
Sally: Don't you think a couple decades of war and rampant xenophobia have already done a pretty good job of inflaming that issue? I'd say multiple military campaigns through that region and the resultant fear and instability give them plenty to work with. And no, I don't think that he
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
hubbub, but that doesn't negate the fact that the statement was """"mistakenly untrue"""" at best when said and a """"complete fabrication designed to attack Trump head on"""" at worst. Again, if we put the shoe on the other foot, we'd probably be gleefully collecting signatures to force a public apology.
